#  Fees -- Department for International Students AGH 

URL: https://www.international.agh.edu.pl/en/studies/fees
Crawled: 2025-03-19 21:19:56

Skip to content

Skip to footer

Some fields of study/specializations will be opened provided a certain number of candidates is accepted.

 Deadlines for paying tuition fees 

Payment for the first semester:
 if you start studies in October – pay until 15 October,
 if you start studies in February/March – pay until 15 March.

Payment for the next semesters:
 for winter semester – pay until 30 September,
 for summer semester – pay until 15 March.

Fees may be converted into Polish zlotys at the average euro exchange rate of the National Bank of Poland on the day of payment.

For a bank account number, contact your Faculty Office.

 Who does not pay for education 

As an international student, you will be admitted to the AGH University on a 
fee-payment basis
. However, there are some exceptions.

Tuition fee for 
full-time studies in Polish language
 is not collected from:

holder of a valid 
Card of the Pole (Karta Polaka)
 or a holder of decision on 
Polish descent
;

holder of a 
permanent residence permit
 or a holder of a 
European Community long-term residence permit
;

holder of a 
refugee status
 in Poland or has been granted 
temporary or complementary protection
 in the Republic of Poland;

Citizens of Ukraine who came to Poland from Ukraine since February 24, 2022 in connection with hostilities carried out on the territory of this country 
have temporary protection until September 30, 2025
.

Those who have received from the Office for Foreigners a certificate of temporary protection with an expiry date of March 4, 2023, September 4, 2023, March 4, 2024 or March 4, 2025 
do not need to apply for new documents. Certificates issued will remain valid until March 4, 2026
.

holder of a certificate confirming their command of Polish language at minimum level C-1, issued by the 
State Commission for the Certification of Proficiency in Polish as a Foreign Language
;

a citizen of a Member State of the 
European Union
, the 
Swiss Confederation
 or a Member State of the 
European Free Trade Association (EFTA)
 - a party to the Agreement on the European Economic Area and members of their family residing in the Republic of Poland;

citizen of the 
United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland
 and members of their family, residing in the Republic of Poland; 

holder of a 
temporary residence permit
 issued for the purposes of 
family reunification
 (the decision granting a permit must include Art. 159 section 1 of the Act on non-nationals);

holder of a 
temporary residence permit
 due to the fact that 
he/she is a holder of a European Community long-term residence permit
 issued in another EU country (Art. 186 section 1 subsection 3 of Act on non-nationals)

holder of a 
temporary residence permit
 issued due to the fact that 
he/she is a member of the family of a holder of a European Community long-term residence permit
 issued in another EU country (Art. 186 section 1 subsection 4 of Act on 12 December 2013 on non-nationals)

spouse, ascendant (parent) or descendant (child) of Polish citizen residing in the Republic of Poland.

Exemption from tuition fees:
 if you are qualified for studies and you have a decision of the Polish National Agency for Academic Exchange (NAWA), a decision of the minister or a letter from NAWA - your financial conditions at the AGH University will be determined in accordance with this decision (e.g. exemption from tuition fees).

Part-time students with the Card of the Pole, permanent residence card, C-1 certificate or another document specified above also pay fees according to the table in the "Tuition fee" section.

 Recruitment fee 

In recruitment for the 2024/2025 academic year, the recruitment fees is 
PLN 100
 for each Bachelor/Master field of study (declaration).

Pay for the declarations separately for individual forms (full-time/part-time) and levels (Bachelor/Master) of studies. The combined payment of declarations, e.g. for full-time and part-time Bachelor studies, may result in problems with proper crediting of payments.

Pay via the e-Card electronic payment system or to the account number provided in the e-Rekrutacja system.

The date of payment is considered as a date of crediting eCard account - for electronic payments or the day of crediting the AGH University bank account.

In case of transfer the recruitment fee does not apply.

 Payment for a student ID card 

The cost of issuing a student ID in the form of an electronic smart card (ELS) is 
PLN 22
.

Recruitment

Pay the fee for your student ID card via eCard quick electronic payment system or to the bank account provided in the e-Rekrutacja system.

The fee is not collected from candidates who are the AGH University students and the AGH University graduates who have completed their studies within one year from the date of commencement of a given recruitment.

Transfer

Pay the fee for your student ID card directly to the account number provided by the Dean's Office.

 AGH University Regulations on charging fees 

Order No. 29/2019 of the AGH University Rector of 8 July 2019 on the Regulations on charging fees for higher education at the AGH University of Krakow (uniform text) PDF, 229 KB - English version
